instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2950: What is 820-2950? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2950</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic after replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: I know these boards have issue with <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> however even after replacing with a bigger one. I am still getting kernel panic. measures 1.3v Initially when i touch the probe though i can see for like a split second it reads 3.3v?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2950</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic after replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
I hope you didn't use hot air.
That cap is very easy to remove lifting pads one by one, just soldering iron...
Using hot air you can make more damage...

If you really used a quality cap (low ESR), now reflow GMUX.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2950</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic after replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: legend. now booting. looks like it is working now. gmux reflow solved issue.
